intro: Micromeria × angosturae, commonly known as the hybrid starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or coastal environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
